*div1 type="summary"* *p*James Norton to Austin, May 29, 1826. Interest in Texas. Commerce and shipping.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="05-20-1826">20th May 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*To*person_mentioned* Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*Sir,*/p*
*p*Since I had the honor of seeing you in the City of *location_mentioned*New Orleans */location_mentioned*I have never relaxed in my good opinion of your *location_mentioned*settlement */location_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*: but pecuniary embarrassments together with other circumstances have hitherto prevented my making a visit there since I went down in the Schooner Lively which then belonged to you.*/p* *p*The Bob Roy, *person_mentioned*Capt Jn° F. Field*/person_mentioned* who is charged with the note, will arrive at the*location_mentioned* mouth of the Brassos */location_mentioned*(weather permitting) in about ten or twelve days. By said vessel on her return I should be happy to hear from you as I as well as *person_mentioned*Capt. Z. Butler*/person_mentioned* who sailed the Lively after our first arrival here in *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1822">1822 */date_mentioned*have still a great inclination to become *person_mentioned*Citizens */person_mentioned*of your *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*: which the settlement of our private interests in this *location_mentioned*State */location_mentioned*has hitherto prevented, yet with you we hope that our inclination has not been lost sight of; *person_mentioned*Capt Field*/person_mentioned* is in a certain measure acquainted with the embarrassments which have heretofore prevented us from being with you which I hope will not be the case this *date_mentioned n="Summer - 1826">Summer*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*The Rob Roy sails with a full freight and *person_mentioned*passangers */person_mentioned*for the *location_mentioned*settlement */location_mentioned*all of which I exerted my feeble interest to forward with a firm belief that I was enhancing the interests of the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*which has been my constant study since I had the honor of your acquaintance in this *location_mentioned*city*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Accept Sir, my sincerest regard for your welfare and that of your *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*: to the enterprising *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*of which I tender the warmest sentiments of respect and flatter myself with the reality of one day becoming a *person_mentioned*neighbor */person_mentioned*and friend among them—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James Norton*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
